intro: Cyrtandra nanawaleensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically white or yellow in color. The plant is often found growing in moist, shaded areas such as forests and rocky crevices. It has small, elliptical leaves and produces fruit that contains minute seeds. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
